WNYC, Municipal Broadcasting System
2500 Municipal Building
New York 7, N. Y.
January 26, 1952
Mr* Seymour Siegel
President, NAEB
New York City, New York
Dear Sis
May I congratulate you again for having done a magnificent job of
riding herd on our meeting last weekend and tell you how good it was
to see you. We shall have to wait, of course, till our February
meeting, which I understand is to be on the 15th and 16th, to find out
what effect our actions had upon Jim, on Will, and upon the Kellogg
deal as a whole. I don’t know how you feel about the work we accom¬
plished but I was very pleased with the over-all job and glad to see
the new members of the Board kicking in with their rough and ready Tr¬
actions.
I am sure you will agree with me that one of our biggest jobs,
and most pressing, is the vitalizing of our committee on school broad¬
casts and an all-out effort to provide specific services to the public
school people. I hope you will prod A1 to get his committee at work
immediately and will authorize Kellogg funds to implement their
meetings and any projects they undertake. I am convinced that this
group can accomplish a great deal more operating within the NAEB
structure than as an independent group, but the time has come when
we must make concrete our hopes for providing services for this group.
In other words, we must push forward to provide them services or
acknowledge that we cannot and let them get out and organize their
own group for self-help.
I think you have done a wonderful job of setting up committees
for the year, with the possible exception of making me chairman of
the relay network committee, and we should see a sizeable amount of
progress during the next eight or ten months. I hope you will get
out letters to the chairmen of these committees outlining our duties
and suggesting meetings, etc. Shall I notify the members of my
committee of their appointments or will you and should I begin to
make plans to get this committee together, possibly at the Columbus
meeting, and should I prepare specific recommendations for the
consideration of the Executive Committee concerning this committee
assignment?
I know you have your hands full on a number of things and I
will not push you for a reply to these questions but I shall be
interested in instructions from you. Again, congratulations upon
having done a terrific job of riding herd on a rough range during
the past weekend. Let me know about the Executive Committee meeting
dates as soon as possible.
Representing non-commercial, educational, radio and television stations, workshops, and production
centers, owned and operated by colleges, universities, school systems and public-service agencies.
